DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Index Date To Sectioning Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of days from the participant's index date to the date on which the biospecimen was cut into very thin slices of tissue or other substance.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._To cut a very thin slice of tissue or other substance.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:To cut a very thin slice of tissue or other substance.

Concepts.definition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
To cut a an entity into slices.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/31/22 jk released for HTAN use.  2/10/22 jk created for SRRS Biospecimen upload data set.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Determining the number or amount of something.

ValueDomain.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/27/10 jk released per MCL SME.  12/2/19 jk created for calculated Offset dates.
ValueDomain.administrativeNotes: 1/18/23 Updated UOM to 'day' per CRDC DSS. mr
